children.markdown:
Here’s what’s caught my eye today:
- [10 things every journalist should know in 2010](http://blogs.journalism.co.uk/editors/2010/01/04/ten-things-every-journalist-should-know-in-2010/) - Kevin Marsh writing about [the end of journalism “as we know it”](http://www.guardian.co.uk/commentisfree/2010/jan/04/citizenmedia-bbc). - Local paper uses a [community politics idea to encourge engagement on its site](http://www.nytimes.com/2010/01/04/business/media/04click.html). - Marc Reeves examines [the reasoning behind his new hyper-local blog](http://marcreeves.blogspot.com/2010/01/going-extra-mile.html#more). - Here’s [Jay Rosen](http://journalism.nyu.edu/pubzone/weblogs/pressthink/) talking about [dealing with audience atomisation](http://www.vimeo.com/8437357). (Shame on [Media140](http://www.aroundtheworldin140days.com/) for limiting embedding of that video) - And how’s this for a magazine concept on a tablet device?
